fields.name: updateAll
fields.description:
A request to update all pattern groups mapping to classifications at once.
This endpoint requires you to provide all the available pattern groups, along with all your classifications at once.

The order of the classification in the array will define it's precedence in the priority of classification when information of different classification is found in the system.
Making the first classification of the array the most prioritary one (ie: Top secret), and the last one the least prioritary (ie: Public)

It is also possible to assign a null classification to a pattern group, meaning that the information matching this classification will no longer be returned by the API on any endpoint, and these information will be excldued from risk score calculations for new information.

inputFields.name: classifications
inputFields.description:
The new classifications to import. This will delete all existing classifications and replace them with the ones provided.
The order of the classification is defined by the risk score associated to the classifications.

inputFields.name: patternGroups
inputFields.description: The association of the pattern groups to their classifications.

inputFields.name: label
inputFields.description: The name of the classification

inputFields.name: riskScoreMultiplier
inputFields.description:
The risk score multiplier that will be given to the patterns that are part of this classification.

The pattern's specific multiplier can be overwritten if wished.

inputFields.name: patternGroupId
inputFields.description: The ID of the target pattern group

inputFields.name: classificationLabel
inputFields.description: The label of the classification. Can also be null, indicating that the pattern group should be unclassified.

types.description: A reference choices for indicators

enumValues.name: INFO_ACCUMULATION
enumValues.description:
Reference for info accumulation indicators. This means that the people connected to this indicator accumulated new data while being monitored.

Corresponds to IND-IA

enumValues.name: INFO_REDUCTION
enumValues.description:
Reference for info reduction indicators. This means that the people connected to this indicator got a reduction of sensitive data while being monitored.

Corresponds to IND-IR

enumValues.name: INFO_INVENTORY
enumValues.description:
Reference for inventory indicators. This kind of indicator is raised when sensors find sensitive data during a full scan.

Corresponds to IND-II

enumValues.name: EXFILTRATION_REMOVABLE_MEDIA
enumValues.description:
Reference for exfiltration indicators. This kind of indicator is raised when sensors detect sensitive data being moved or copied on an external removable drive.

Corresponds to IND-RM

types.name: PatternAttributesFilters
types.description:
Filters used to match a pattern. All filters are applied with a AND condition, so it will match patterns that respect ALL the critera given.

For all filters, if they are not provided (null), they are simply ignored. Thus, if all filters are null, all patterns are matched.

types.name: PatternGroupAttributesFilters
types.description:
Filters used to match a pattern group. All filters are applied with a AND condition, so it will match pattern groups that respect ALL the critera given.

For all filters, if they are not provided (null), they are simply ignored. Thus, if all filters are null, all pattern groups are matched.

fields.name: log

inputFields.description: Filters log event using a full text query.

inputFields.description: Filters on the caller by ID. The caller is the entity responsible for generating this log, so either a UserID or an OAuth2ClientID.

inputFields.description: Filters on caller type.

inputFields.description: Filters on the kind of audit entries

inputFields.description: Allow filtering on audit log timestamps by range.

args.defaultValue: [{field: "timestamp", order: DESC, clean: false, ignoreCase: false}]

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the event audited.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: The moment the action was accomplished.

fields.name: caller
fields.description:
The caller that initiated the action.

For now, only users are supported, but eventually this will be generalized to include Oauth2 clients.

It could be null if the user is hard-deleted from the authentication system or the SSO integration is changed.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: The type of event audited.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
English textual description of the action the user accomplished.
It contains details that allows understanding the context.

It uses the readable names of the objects implicated in the action at the moment it was taken.
As such, these names could be outdated if consulted in the future (for example, a user was renamed).

fields.name: tokens
fields.description:
Extended queries are always converted to tokens, and some tokens may be ignored by the query engine.
This endpoint returns only the tokens used in the extended queries.
This is mostly useful for highlighting results.

fields.name: people
fields.description:
A field to perform an extended search on people.
An extended search on people with correlate
people, file, info, hosts and notes, and group
all those by the person that owns them, returning
always maximum one result of each entity.

That meaning, a person is always returned, and other entities might be null,
depending on the relevance ordering of search results.

Due to limitations, this endpoint enforces a minimum of 3 characters per search token.

fields.name: create
fields.description:
Create a new policy with the fields taken from the request.

By default, the newly created policy will be assigned the lowest priority possible, and will be affected to no groups of sensors.

fields.name: update
fields.description: Updates the policy with the following request fields

fields.name: updateDefault
fields.description: Modify the default scan policy.

fields.name: delete
fields.description:
Deletes a policy by ID

The remaining policies are re-ordered to reflect the new priority without the deleted policy.

fields.name: resetDefault
fields.description: Reset the default resource policy to default configuration.

fields.name: updatePriorities
fields.description:
Update the priority of all the policies of the tenant.

This query will re-order policies according to the order of the input policies ID array, so all available policies MUST be specified, or an error will be returned.

fields.name: addGroups
fields.description: Adds the target groups to the policy target groups. Doing so will make the given policy affect all the sensors that are members of the groups.

fields.name: removeGroups
fields.description: Removes the target groups from the policies affected groups. All sensors affected by this policy will no longer be, and the next most prioritary policy will have precedence.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
